intro: Agelaea rubiginosa, commonly known as the red-stemmed agelaea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from pale yellow to deep red. Agelaea rubiginosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
